title: 103_hr287
content: AMENDMENTS TO THE CIVIL SERVICE RETIREMENT SYSTEM. The Civil Service Retirement System is amended to include a new section on survivor elections, deposits, and offsets. Individuals making certain elections must deposit an amount determined by the Office of Personnel Management to reflect the annuity reduction, plus interest. The Office will regulate the payment process. The Office will regulate the payment process for deposits required for annuity reductions, ensuring actuarial equivalence and limiting the reduction to 25 percent of the annuity. Reductions are effective upon election and are not affected by changes in marital status. The Office regulates annuity reductions, ensuring actuarial equivalence and limiting the reduction to 25 percent of the annuity. Reductions are effective upon election and not affected by changes in marital status. Subsections (a) and (b) do not apply if an election is made under specific sections and the total amount withheld from the annuity does not affect the survivor's entitlement to receive the elected annuity. The Office regulates annuity reductions, ensuring actuarial equivalence and limiting the reduction to 25 percent of the annuity. Reductions are effective upon election and not affected by changes in marital status. Survivor annuity amounts are specified under section 8339(j)(3), (j)(5)(C), or (k)(2) without impacting the survivor's entitlement to receive the elected annuity. Section 8339(j)(3) and (j)(5)(C) of title 5, United States Code, are amended regarding survivor elections and offsets. An election must be made at retirement or within 2 years after divorce, becoming effective the first day of the second month after received by the Office. The effective date of election and reduction after remarriage is specified, with certain clauses being amended or struck. Section 8339(k)(2) of title 5, United States Code, is amended by redesignating clauses and striking certain subparagraphs. Section 8334(h) of title 5, United States Code, is amended by removing certain references. AMENDMENTS TO THE FEDERAL EMPLOYEES' RETIREMENT SYSTEM. Amendments to the Federal Employees' Retirement System include changes to the deposit requirements for employees or Members, with a maximum annuity reduction of 25 percent to cover the deposit. The amendments to the Federal Employees' Retirement System involve changes to deposit requirements, limiting the combination of deposits to 25 percent of the annuity calculated under specific sections. Reductions in annuity are effective upon election and are additional to any other reductions specified. Subsections (a) and (b) do not apply if an election under section 8416 or 8417(b) is made after an election under section 8420, which becomes void. The amendments to the Federal Employees' Retirement System involve changes to deposit requirements and limitations on annuity reductions. The total amount withheld from an annuity does not affect the survivor's entitlement to receive the elected annuity. Technical amendments are made to sections 8416 and 8417 of title 5, United States Code. The reduction in annuity shall take effect the first day of the second month after the election is received by the Office, but not less than 9 months after the marriage date. An election under this subsection must be made at the time of retirement or within 2 years after the dissolution of the marriage, and it will become effective the first day of the second month after the election is received by the Office. The amendments made by this Act will take effect on the first day of the first month beginning at least 30 days after the date of enactment. Regulations will be established for deposits not fully paid before the effective date to apply reductions.
